info.title: Kadena Wallet Signing API
info.description:
This API facilitates communication between dapps and wallets. This frees dapp
developers from the complexity of managing private keys, allowing them to focus
on the functionality and business logic of the application.`

Whenever the dapp needs to send a signed transaction, all you have to do is make
an AJAX request to this API on localhost port 9467 and the user's wallet app
will handle all the details of transaction signing for you.

SigningResponse.description: wallet response that includes the signed transaction

Command.description: transaction command with stringified JSON payload (cmd)

UserSig.description: crypto signature by secret key of command payload

TypedHash.description: blake2 hash in base64 of command payload

ChainId.description: chainweb chain ID where the transaction will be executed

SigningRequest.description: transaction information sent to the wallet for signing

DappCap.description: a capability required by the transaction with amplifying information to help the user

SigCapability.description: a capability and any arguments it requires

GasLimit.description: max number of gas units you want to spend on this transaction

TTLSeconds.description: number of seconds the transaction can wait in the mempool before expiring

AccountName.description:
The name of an account in the coin contract. In the SigningRequest sender field,
this will be the account used to pay the transaction's gas price.
